net.sf.rcer.conn.connections
Interface IConnectionData

All Known Subinterfaces:
IConnection
All Known Implementing Classes:
Connection, ConnectionData, ProvidedConnectionData
public interface IConnectionData

A set of connection data used to connect to a SAP R/3 system. Objects implementing this interface usually describe the way to connect to a SAP R/3 system. If you're looking for an established connection, see IConnection.

Author:
vwegert
See Also:
IConnection

Method Detail

getConnectionDataID

java.lang.String getConnectionDataID()
Returns:
the ID of the connection data set. Note that this is NOT the ID of the actual connection.

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns:
the human-readable description of the system connection

getSystemID

java.lang.String getSystemID()
Returns:
the system ID (SID) of the SAP R/3 system

getConnectionType

ConnectionType getConnectionType()
Returns:
the connection type. If a direct connection is used, an application server and a system number must be provided. If a messages server is used, the message server, the port and the group name must be provided.

isDirectConnection

boolean isDirectConnection()
Returns:
true if the connection is a direct connection, false if load balancing is used.
See Also:
getConnectionType()

isLoadBalancedConnection

boolean isLoadBalancedConnection()
Returns:
true if load balancing is used, false if the connection is a direct connection.
See Also:
getConnectionType()

getRouter

java.lang.String getRouter()
Returns:
the SAP router string

getApplicationServer

java.lang.String getApplicationServer()
Returns:
the address or name of the application server to use for direct connections

getSystemNumber

int getSystemNumber()
Returns:
the system number to use for direct connections

getMessageServer

java.lang.String getMessageServer()
Returns:
the address or name of the message server to use for load balancing

getMessageServerPort

int getMessageServerPort()
Returns:
the port of the message server to use for load balancing

getLoadBalancingGroup

java.lang.String getLoadBalancingGroup()
Returns:
the name of the group used for load balancing

getDefaultUser

java.lang.String getDefaultUser()
Returns:
the default user name to use for logon

isDefaultUserEditable

boolean isDefaultUserEditable()
Returns:
whether the user may change the default user name during logon

getDefaultClient

java.lang.String getDefaultClient()
Returns:
the default client to use for logon

isDefaultClientEditable

boolean isDefaultClientEditable()
Returns:
whether the user may change the default client during logon

getDefaultLocale

Locale getDefaultLocale()
Returns:
the default locale to use during logon

isDefaultLocaleEditable

boolean isDefaultLocaleEditable()
Returns:
whether the user may change the default locale during logon
